#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Firuz Bey
#Text=Firuz Bey ( fl. 1495 – 1515 ) was a 15th and 16th-century Ottoman military officer , Sanjak-bey of the Sanjak of Scutari and Sanjak of Bosnia .
#Text=Origin
#Text=Firuz
#Text=Bey belonged to the Mihaloğlu family , a noted akinji family that was instrumental in the conquest of the Balkans .
#Text=Career
#Text=Bosnia
#Text=From 1495 to 1496 , Firuz was sanjak-bey of the Sanjak of Bosnia . [ 1 ]
#Text=His predecessor Jahja Pasha built a mosque in Sarajevo during his reign in Bosnia ( 1494 – 95 ) but did not provide a water supply to it .
#Text=According to a legend , he asked his successor , Firuz Bey to do so from Sedrenik to the Jahja Pasha mosque .
#Text=Firuz
#Text=Bey did so and also built a public tap in honour of his predecessor . [ 2 ]
#Text=Scutari

#Text=Firuz Bey held the position of Sanjak-bey of the Sanjak of Scutari from 1496 to 1502 . [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Đurađ Crnojević who controlled the neighboring Principality of Zeta maintained frequent correspondence with other Christian feudal states with the intention of establishing an anti-Ottoman coalition .

#Text=When his brother Stefan betrayed him to the Ottomans in 1496 , [ 5 ] Đurađ proposed to accept the suzerainty of the Ottoman Empire and Firuz Bey if they allowed him to remain as governor in Zeta .
#Text=Firuz
#Text=Bey refused this proposal and invited Đurađ to either come to Scutari to clarify his anti-Ottoman activities or to flee Zeta .
#Text=When Firuz Bey attacked Zeta with strong forces in 1496 Đurađ was forced to flee to Venice . [ 6 ]
#Text=In 1497 , Firuz Bey captured Grbalj and put Zeta under his effective military control , although it was still part of the Zeta governed by Stefan Crnojević . [ 7 ]
#Text=In 1499 , Firuz Bey formally annexed Zeta to the territory of Sanjak of Scutari , [ 7 ] [ 6 ] after he became suspicious of Stefan because of his connections with Venice .
#Text=Firuz
#Text=Bey invited Stefan Crnojević to Skadar where he imprisoned him .
#Text=It is thought that Stefan probably died in prison since he was never mentioned again in historical sources . [ 8 ]
#Text=In 1499 , Firuz
#Text=Bey organized raids of the territory around Durazzo .
#Text=It was poorly defended and its population would have surrendered if Firuz Bey had brought more forces . [ 9 ]
#Text=During the same year Firuz Bey joined Isa Pasha and raided the inland of Dalmatia . [ 10 ]
#Text=In 1501 , Firuz Bey captured Durazzo . [ 11 ]
#Text=After the Ottoman – Venetian War ( 1499 – 1503 ) , Firuz
#Text=Bey became the Ottoman representative for the region of Cattaro . [ 12 ]
#Text=Bosnia
#Text=After the death of Skender Pasha in November 1504 , Firuz Bey became Sanjak-bey of the Sanjak of Bosnia again . [ 13 ]
#Text=The first mention of the name of the city Sarajevo was in a 1507 letter written by Firuz Bey . [ 14 ]
#Text=In 1509 , he built a hammam ( Bosnian : Ćifte hamam ) in Sarajevo and several shops around it as its vakif . [ 15 ]
#Text=He also built a maktab ( elementary school ) [ 16 ] and madrasa before 1515 .
#Text=This was the oldest madrasa in Sarajevo and one of the oldest in Bosnia . [ 17 ]
#Text=In 1528 , the neighborhood of this madrasa developed into a mahala named Mahala of Firuz Beg 's Madrasa ( Bosnian : Mahala Firuz-begove medrese ) . [ 18 ]
#Text=Legacy
#Text=Until 1945 , one street in Sarajevo was named after Firuz Bey . [ 19 ]
#Text=After Bosnia and Herzegovina seceded from Yugoslavia in 1992 , one street is again named after Firuz Bey . [ 20 ]
#Text=His madrasa was destroyed at the end of the 17th century by the army of Eugene of Savoy . [ 21 ]
#Text=His hammam was operational until 1810 when it was closed because of the poor state of its roof .
#Text=The building slowly deteriorated and was almost completely destroyed right before the First World War .
#Text=The site and remains of this hammam are defined as a National Monument of Bosnia and Herzegovina since 2008 . [ 22 ]
